articles.author: JEFF McMURRAY
articles.description: When a small city abruptly parked all its buses to launch a publicly subsidized van service offering $1.50 trips anywhere in town, only one of its bus drivers — a big-city transplant — went along for the ride.
articles.title: What if public transit was like Uber? A small city ended its bus service to find out

articles.author: PAUL J. WEBER and JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: AUSTIN, Texas (AP) — Republican Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton was fully acquitted Saturday of corruption charges following a historic impeachment trial, a resounding verdict that reaffirms the power of the GOP's hard right and puts an indicted incumbent who remains under FBI investigation back into office.
articles.title: Republican Texas AG Ken Paxton is acquitted of corruption charges at historic impeachment trial

articles.author: ROBERT F. BUKATY and DAVID SHARP
articles.description: BAR HARBOR, Maine (AP) — The center of post-tropical cyclone Lee made landfall Saturday in Nova Scotia, Canada, with sustained winds of 70 mph (110 kph), U.S. weather officials said Saturday.The storm’s center came ashore about 135 miles (215 kilometers) west of Halifax, Nova Scotia, the U.S.
articles.title: Post-tropical cyclone Lee makes landfall in Nova Scotia, Canada with winds of 70 miles per hour

articles.author: DAVID KOENIG
articles.description: DALLAS (AP) — Car shoppers are heading for a new round of sticker shock if the strike by the United Auto Workers doesn’t end soon, particularly for popular vehicles that are already in short supply.
articles.title: The auto workers strike will drive up car prices, but not right away — unless consumers panic

articles.author: STEPHEN GROVES
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — On one side of the Capitol, two senators have steered the debate over government funding mostly clear of partisan fights, creating a path for bills to pass with bipartisan momentum.
articles.title: The Senate's bipartisan approach to government funding is putting pressure on a divided House

articles.author: WILL WEISSERT and THOMAS BEAUMONT
articles.description: DES MOINES, Iowa (AP) — Some of Donald Trump 's top rivals for the Republican presidential nomination will address a gathering of influential Iowa evangelical Christians on Saturday night, hoping to woo them away from the former president at an event he is skipping.
articles.title: Trump skips Iowa gathering of evangelical Christians. His rivals hope for a chance to gain ground

articles.author: TARA COPP
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — In the months since a single senator froze military promotions over the Pentagon’s abortion policy, the uniformed officers affected have been largely silent, wary of stepping into a political fray.
articles.title: Military officers begin to speak out on the harm done by Sen. Tuberville's holds on promotions

articles.author: JEFF McMURRAY
articles.description: When a small city abruptly parked all its buses to launch a publicly subsidized van service offering $1.50 trips anywhere in town, only one of its bus drivers — a big-city transplant — went along for the ride.
articles.title: What if public transit was like Uber? A small city ended its bus service to find out

articles.author: TOM MURPHY
articles.description: When she prescribes the popular weight-loss drug Wegovy, Dr. Angela Fitch sends patients on a quest she likens to “The Hunger Games."
articles.title: Supply problems and insurance issues make popular weight-loss drugs hard to get

articles.author: SETH BORENSTEIN
articles.description: The heat is about to be turned up on fossil fuels, the United States and President Joe Biden.As a record-smashing and deadly hot summer draws to a close, the United Nations and the city that hosts it are focusing on climate change and the burning of coal, oil and natural gas that causes it.
articles.title: Special UN summit, protests, week of talk turn up heat on fossil fuels and global warming
